main event: A sighting of an unidentified object in Albuquerque, New Mexico on August 10, 1955.
interesting points: The object was described as a round, disc-shaped, silver object that trailed smoke.
The object traveled northwest and then remained stationary.
The sighting lasted for approximately 15 minutes.
Weather balloons released from Kirtland AFB were in the area at the time of the sighting, and it was concluded the object was likely one of these balloons.
Three aircraft from the 54th Air Division were scrambled to investigate but could not find any trace of the object.
